column1: # Enhanced GitHub Issues for Project 24-105 with Model Routing

column3: description
column9: model_reasoning

column3: Create the database repository class with CRUD operations for truck_tickets table. Include: create(), get_by_id(), get_by_ticket_number(), update(), soft_delete(). Must handle foreign key lookups and validation.
column9: Critical business logic with foreign key coordination and validation rules

column2: Generate SQLAlchemy ORM models from SQL schema
column3: Auto-generate SQLAlchemy models for all 9 tables: jobs, materials, sources, destinations, vendors, ticket_types, truck_tickets, review_queue, processing_runs. Include relationships and constraints.
column9: Mechanical transform from SQL schema to ORM models

column2: Create seed data scripts (13 sources + 3 destinations)
column3: Generate scripts to insert reference data: 13 source locations, 3 destinations, initial vendors. Use bulk_insert_mappings for performance. Include validation.
column9: Boilerplate data insertion with clear structure

column3: Implement TicketRepository.check_duplicate() that queries for (ticket_number, vendor_id) within 120-day rolling window. If found: set duplicate_of, review_required=True, route to review queue.
column9: Critical business rule with compliance implications

column3: CRITICAL: Every CLASS_2_CONTAMINATED ticket MUST have manifest_number OR be routed to review queue with CRITICAL severity. Zero tolerance for missed manifests (regulatory).
column9: 100% recall requirement for regulatory compliance

column3: Create parser for format: {JOB}__{DATE}__{AREA}__{FLOW}__{MATERIAL}__{VENDOR}.pdf. Extract components with validation. Support legacy formats as fallback.
column9: Deterministic regex-based parsing with clear rules

column3: Build the master pipeline: PDF→pages→OCR→vendor detection→field extraction→normalization→duplicate check→DB insert OR review queue. Coordinate all extractors and handle errors.
column9: Complex cross-module orchestration requiring deep reasoning

column3: Route extraction failures to review_queue table with severity levels (CRITICAL/WARNING/INFO). Handle: MISSING_MANIFEST, MISSING_TICKET_NUMBER, LOW_CONFIDENCE_OCR, DUPLICATE_TICKET.
column9: Compliance-critical decision logic with regulatory implications

column3: Build loaders for synonyms.json, filename_schema.yml, acceptance.yml, output_config.yml, and vendor/*.yml templates. Include validation and error handling.
column9: Configuration loading boilerplate with validation

column3: Build precedence system: filename > folder > OCR > defaults. Never override manual DB/UI corrections. Apply to all fields: date, source, destination, material, vendor.
column9: Multi-layer decision logic with overrides and fallbacks

column3: Create mock PDF pages with known ground truth for all vendors: WM Lewisville, LDI Yard, Post Oak, Heidelberg. Include edge cases: poor scans, missing fields, duplicates.
column9: Test data generation following established patterns

column3: Generate tracking_export.xlsx with sheets: All Daily, Class2_Daily, Non Contaminated, Spoils, Import. Must match legacy format exactly. Include Job Week/Month calculations.
column9: Complex SQL pivots and business logic for report generation

column3: Add comprehensive docstrings to all classes and functions. Include type hints (Python 3.10+). Generate with examples for complex functions.
column9: Documentation generation following standard patterns

column3: Create SQL functions or Python utilities: fn_CalculateJobWeek() and fn_CalculateJobMonth(). Format: 'Week 16 - (End 10/20/24)' and '004 - October 24'. Based on job_start_date.
column9: Business logic for date calculations with specific formatting

column3: Update README.md to reflect current state: completed modules, pending work, architecture diagrams. Auto-generate from code structure.
column9: Documentation sync - mechanical update

column3: Design test framework for end-to-end pipeline: PDF input → database records + Excel output. Include gold standard comparison and accuracy measurement.
column9: Test architecture design requiring system understanding

column3: Generate pipe-delimited CSV with columns: ticket_number|vendor|date|material|quantity|units|truck_number|file_ref. Sort by vendor, date, ticket_number.
column9: Business report with specific formatting and sorting rules

column3: Generate regulatory manifest log with columns: ticket_number, manifest_number, date, source, waste_facility, material, quantity, units, truck_number, file_ref. 5-year retention requirement.
column9: Regulatory compliance report with critical data requirements

column3: Create command-line interface: --input, --job, --export-xlsx, --export-invoice, --export-manifest, --export-review, --threads, --dry-run, --verbose. Include help text.
column9: CLI boilerplate with standard argument parsing

column2: Implement batch processing with error recovery
column3: Add multi-threaded PDF processing with thread pool. Handle errors gracefully: log failures, continue processing, rollback on critical errors. Track progress.
column9: Complex error handling and coordination across threads

column3: Implement processing_runs table management: log run_id, request_guid, timestamps, file/page counts, success/error stats. Link to truck_tickets via request_guid.
column9: Audit trail coordination across multiple tables

column2: Generate mock vendor templates (LDI Yard + Post Oak)
column3: Create vendor template YAMLs for LDI_YARD.yml and POST_OAK_PIT.yml following WM_LEWISVILLE.yml pattern. Include ROI coordinates, regex patterns, logo detection.
column9: Template generation following established pattern

column3: Implement template matching for vendor logos using OpenCV. WM Lewisville logo detection with confidence threshold 0.85. Return vendor_id or None.
column9: Computer vision logic with confidence scoring

column3: Export review queue to CSV with columns: page_id, reason, severity, file_path, page_num, detected_fields (JSON), suggested_fixes (JSON), created_at.
column9: CSV export following standard format

column3: Add database indexes, optimize JOIN queries, implement query result caching for reference tables (sources, destinations, vendors). Measure before/after performance.
column9: Performance optimization requiring SQL expertise

column3: Implement automated tests for spec v1.1 acceptance criteria: ≥95% ticket accuracy, 100% manifest recall, ≥97% vendor accuracy, ≤3 sec/page, etc.
column9: Test design based on complex business requirements

column3: Create API docs for all public functions and classes. Include examples, parameter descriptions, return values. Auto-generate from docstrings.
column9: Documentation generation from code structure

column3: Set up Alembic for schema versioning. Create initial migration for 9 tables. Add upgrade/downgrade scripts.
column9: Migration script boilerplate following Alembic patterns

column3: Calculate SHA-256 hash for each processed PDF. Store in truck_tickets.file_hash. Add verification function to detect file tampering.
column9: Compliance-related file integrity verification

column3: Unit tests for SynonymNormalizer: test all 50+ synonym mappings for vendors, sources, destinations, materials. Include edge cases.
column9: Unit test generation for deterministic mappings

column3: Build Grafana/Prometheus dashboard: processing throughput, error rates, review queue size, manifest recall %, duplicate detection accuracy. Track SLA metrics.
column9: Dashboard design requiring metric selection and visualization strategy
